intro: Ambulia ebracteata, commonly known as the leafless ambulia, is a unique plant species characterized by its lack of bracts. It is a member of the Ambulia genus, which is part of the family Cucurbitaceae, commonly known as the gourd family. The plant is notable for its simple, unbranched stems and small, inconspicuous flowers. Its leaves are often reduced or absent, giving it a distinctive appearance. This plant is typically found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in humid, shaded environments.
